lexUnit.name: testify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: serve as evidence or proof of something.

sentence.text: Years later her parents made a sworn statement testifying that the couple had met in July 1917 .
To bear and deny depression at the same time may seem like yet another paradox , but my diaries testify that somehow I managed to do both .
The decision came after Congress failed to receive a presidential certification testifying that Pakistan 's nuclear programme was being designed exclusively for peaceful purposes .
One moment the sun had been hanging above the desert , the next it had plunged out of sight , leaving only the copper and rose and saffron of the water to testify that it had been there .

That surely has been testified to today when the very convenor of the panel on doctrine admits that he does n't want the statements to be too clear so that they can be understood and used by people of radically different persuasions .
These results may testify to the attributes of the equipment acquired and the proficiency of foreign trade organisations in tailoring purchases to real needs .
I rather felt it testified to the contrary .
The growing number of empty shops and commercial properties in the High Street testifies to the depth of the slump and the misery in its wake .
Charles had to sign a legal document testifying to that effect the day he inherited .
The massacres of the Paris Communards ( see chapter 9 above ) testify to its force .
While the GLC recognized that lesbians and gays were not one homogenous community , these differences testified to our political heterogeneity .
Research done for Philips testifies to the importance that the police now attach to interrogation of suspects and the procuring of confessions from the guilty .
This alone testifies to the passions that the war aroused among non-Spanish contemporaries , for many of whom its significance went well beyond Spain itself .
Policy making can be conducted in a similar fashion ; indeed , research testifies to its popularity .
That reformers are often frustrated testifies to the reality of what prison is about .
While his work testifies chiefly to his zest , those who knew Hazlitt personally made much of his gloomy irritability .
The blank pages in my diary testify as much , and in addition that I was too apathetic to continue recording just how bored I was in the periods between my bouts of organising activity .
But as the burgeoning health food stores testify , there is a lot more to the dietary supplements market than this .
After emerging from the forest , but still shaded by trees , the road passes the Loch Maree Hotel , proud of the fact that Queen Victoria stayed there , as a roadside plaque testifies .
As contemporary writing testifies , it was the sad end of a glorious period in English history .
